description: This is an application that provides information about the Computer System and Network Technology course at Sungai Buloh Vocational College

pengenalan.title: Introduction
pengenalan.title_description: The Computer & Network Systems Technology program provides students with the basics of business, maintenance, operation and configuration of computers as well as networks and data storage in addition to administrative management and information integration.

vision_mission_details.vision: Vision – Leader of superior technical and vocational education.
vision_mission_details.mission: Mission – Empowering technical and vocational education through the implementation of quality programs.

level_of_study_details.level_of_study_description: This program offers 2 levels of study, namely:-

career_opportunities_details.career_opportunities_description: Among the career opportunities for students of this program:

svm.svm_1: Conducted for 4 semesters that is 2 years.
svm.svm_2: Each course implemented in one SVM semester takes 20 weeks.
svm.svm_3: Consists of 17 weeks of teaching and learning followed by 3 weeks of final assessment.

dvm.dvm_1: Conducted for 5 semesters of 2 years and 6 months.
dvm.dvm_2: Each student who passes the entry requirements for the Malaysian Vocational Diploma will continue learning for 4 semesters and will undergo On-Job-Training (OJT) for 6 months in the 5th semester

pengiktirafan.pengiktirafan_description: The Computer and Network Systems Technology Program has been certified that the academic qualifications awarded are in line with the standards and quality set by the Malaysian Board of Technologists (MBOT).

mbot.mbot_description_1: The Malaysian Board of Technologists (MBOT) is a professional body that gives Professional Recognition to Technologists and Technicians in related technological and technical fields recognized by the Board.
mbot.mbot_description_2: MBOT recognition is required to enable diploma graduates to continue their studies at a higher level.

program_ibm.program_ibm_main_title: IBM-PTech Collaboration Program between IBM and Sungai Buloh Vocational College

synopsis.synopsis_description_1: The Pathways in Technology Early College High Schools (P-TECH) program is a collaboration between the Ministry of Education Malaysia and the Multimedia Development Corporation (MDEC) together with IBM to prepare Malaysian youths for technology-related careers.
synopsis.synopsis_description_2: The P-TECH program was implemented in 2020 together with students from Sungai Buloh Vocational College.
synopsis.synopsis_description_3: This program will be implemented for 4 years starting when the students are in year 1 SVM until year 2 DVM.
synopsis.synopsis_description_4: Students will be exposed to 6 learning modules with mentors who will be supervised by IBM Malaysia.
synopsis.synopsis_description_5: IBM's aim is to produce 'new collars' among students to increase their self-worth by gaining skills, improving their existing skills, acquiring new skills, and mastering cross-domain skills.

senarai_pensyarah.senarai_pensyarah_description: There are 11 experienced and dedicated educators who will assist students in the learning process.

syaratSvm.syaratSvm_1: Study at SMK or Government Aid School
syaratSvm.syaratSvm_2: Apply online and sit for PKSK (Special School Admission Assessment)
syaratSvm.syaratSvm_3: Obtaining PBD, PAJSK and Psychometric Assessment scores
syaratSvm.syaratSvm_6: Interested in the program applied for

syaratDvm.syaratDvm_0: Pass the Malaysian Vocational Certificate and get at least 3 honors including Malay Language Honors 1104
syaratDvm.syaratDvm_1: Achieving Honors Mathematics course equivalent to Grade 2.0 at the Malaysian Vocational Certificate level
syaratDvm.syaratDvm_2: Sit the additional module of the Mathematics course that has been set for students who do not achieve the equivalent of Grade 2.0

syaratTambahan.syaratTambahan_1: For Form 3 graduates, you can study to obtain the Malaysian Vocational Certificate (SVM) before continuing your studies at the DVM level.
syaratTambahan.syaratTambahan_2: Students who succeed at the Certificate level will be awarded:-
syaratTambahan.syaratTambahan_4: Eligible to continue studies at the Diploma level at the same Vocational College if passing the prescribed entry requirements
syaratTambahan.syaratTambahan_5: Students who do not pass the entry requirements for the Diploma level will continue their studies at the same Vocational College in the same field of skills and be awarded the Malaysian Skills Certificate (SKM) based on the level of competence achieved
syaratTambahan.syaratTambahan_6: Students who pass their studies at the Diploma level will be awarded a Diploma by the Vocational College Senate, Ministry of Education Malaysia

pertanyaan_lanjut.pertanyaan_lanjut_1: Any further questions can be contacted via the phone number or email below
pertanyaan_lanjut.pertanyaan_lanjut_3:
Pn. Rohani binti Karim 
(Head of Department)

senarai_kursus.senarai_kursus_desc: The following is a list of subjects offered for the Malaysian Vocational Certificate (Sijil Vokasional Malaysia or SVM) and the Malaysian Vocational Diploma (Diploma Vokasional Malaysia or DVM) courses in computer system technology and networking course.

svm.svm_title: List of subjects offered for the Malaysian Vocational Certificate

dvm.dvm_title: List of subjects offered for the Malaysian Vocational Diploma

sem_2.sem_2_1: MPU2172 APPRECIATION OF ETHICS AND CIVILIZATION
sem_2.sem_2_6: DKB2012 COMPUTER SYSTEM SETUP AND REPAIR

sem_4.sem_4_10: DKB4042 COMPUTER SYSTEM MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT
